001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import edu.pdx.cs410J.ParserException;
004import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
005
006import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
007import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
008import java.io.IOException;
009import java.io.PrintWriter;
010import java.io.StringReader;
011import java.io.StringWriter;
012import java.util.Collection;
013
014import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
015import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.*;
016import static org.mockito.Mockito.*;
017
018/**
019 * A unit test for the {@link AirlineServlet}.  It uses mockito to
020 * provide mock http requests and responses.
021 */
022class AirlineServletTest {
023
024  @Test
025  void missingAirlineNameReturnsPreconditionFailedStatus() throws IOException {
026    AirlineServlet servlet = new AirlineServlet();
027
028    HttpServletRequest request = mock(HttpServletRequest.class);
029    HttpServletResponse response = mock(HttpServletResponse.class);
030    PrintWriter pw = mock(PrintWriter.class);
031
032    when(response.getWriter()).thenReturn(pw);
033
034    servlet.doGet(request, response);
035
036    verify(response).sendError(HttpServletResponse.SC_PRECONDITION_FAILED, Messages.missingRequiredParameter(AirlineServlet.AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER));
037  }
038
039  @Test
040  void addOneFlightToAnAirline() throws IOException {
041    AirlineServlet servlet = new AirlineServlet();
042
043    String airlineName = "Test Airlines";
044    int flightNumber = 123;
045
046    HttpServletRequest request = mock(HttpServletRequest.class);
047    when(request.getParameter(AirlineServlet.AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER)).thenReturn(airlineName);
048    when(request.getParameter(AirlineServlet.FLIGHT_NUMBER_PARAMETER)).thenReturn(String.valueOf(flightNumber));
049
050    HttpServletResponse response = mock(HttpServletResponse.class);
051
052    servlet.doPost(request, response);
053
054    verify(response).setStatus(eq(HttpServletResponse.SC_OK));
055
056    Airline airline = servlet.getOrCreateAirline(airlineName);
057    assertThat(airline, notNullValue());
058    Collection<Flight> flights = airline.getFlights();
059    assertThat(flights, hasSize(1));
060    Flight flight = flights.iterator().next();
061    assertThat(flight.getNumber(), equalTo(flightNumber));
062  }
063
064  @Test
065  void returnTextRepresentationOfAirline() throws IOException, ParserException {
066    String airlineName = "Test Airlines";
067    int flightNumber = 123;
068
069    AirlineServlet servlet = new AirlineServlet();
070    Airline airline = servlet.getOrCreateAirline(airlineName);
071    airline.addFlight(new Flight(flightNumber));
072
073    HttpServletRequest request = mock(HttpServletRequest.class);
074    when(request.getParameter(AirlineServlet.AIRLINE_NAME_PARAMETER)).thenReturn(airlineName);
075
076    HttpServletResponse response = mock(HttpServletResponse.class);
077    StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
078    when(response.getWriter()).thenReturn(new PrintWriter(sw, true));
079
080    servlet.doGet(request, response);
081
082    verify(response).setStatus(eq(HttpServletResponse.SC_OK));
083
084    String text = sw.toString();
085    Airline airline2 = new TextParser(new StringReader(text)).parse();
086
087    assertThat(airline2.getName(), equalTo(airlineName));
088    Collection<Flight> flights = airline2.getFlights();
089    assertThat(flights, hasSize(1));
090    Flight flight = flights.iterator().next();
091    assertThat(flight.getNumber(), equalTo(flightNumber));
092  }
093
094}
